xxl.core.relational.query.operators
Class Equivalences

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.query.operators.Equivalences

public class Equivalences
extends Object

This class provides static methods for creating ready to use instances of an equivalence node in a directed acyclic graph. Beside these methods, it contains constants for identifying local metadata fragments inside an equivalence node's global metadata, methods for accessing them and local metadata factories for updating them.

See Also:
Node

Field Summary
static String ADDITIONAL_UTILIZATION
          This constant is used to identify the additional utilization of an equivalance node, i.e., the number of nodes that are part of an equivalence node's query that cannot be reused.
static String CHOICE
          This constant is used to identify an equivalance node's choice, i.e., the index of the child node that represents the equivalence node's query at this time, inside its global metadata.
static String OPERATOR_TYPE
          This constant can be used to denote that a node represents an equivalence node in the directed acyclic graph.
static String PHYSICAL_REPRESENTATION
          This constant is used to identify the physical representation of an equivalance node, i.e., the physical representation of the equivalence node's choice, inside its global metadata.
static Function<Node,Iterator<Node>> SIGNATURE_OF_CHOICE
          A all-signatures strategy that simple returns the equivalence node's chosen child node.
static Function<Object,MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> TRANSLATION_FUNCTION
          A factory method that can be used to translate (remove) an equivalence node and replace it by the implementation of the chosen child node.
static Function<Object,Node> XML_READER
          A factory method that can be used to transform the XML representation of an equivalence node into the node itself.
static Function<Object,Node> XML_WRITER
          A factory method that can be used to transform an equivalence node into its XML representation.
 
Method Summary
static int getAdditionalUtilization(Node equivalence)
          Returns the additional utilization of the given equivalence node, i.e., the number of nodes that are part of the query represented by the given equivalence node that cannot be reused.
static int getChoice(Node equivalence)
          Returns the choice of the given equivalence node, i.e., the index of the child node that represents the equivalence node's query at this time.
static MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> getPhysicalRepresentation(Node equivalence)
          Returns the physical representation of the given equivalence node, i.e., the physical representation of the given equivalence node's choice.
static Node newEquivalence(int choice, Node... operators)
          Creates a new equivalence node gathering the equivalent queries represented by the given operator nodes (the node having the specified index is the chosen one) and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.
static Node newEquivalence(Iterator<? extends Node> operators, int choice)
          Creates a new equivalence node gathering the equivalent queries represented by the given operator nodes (the node having the specified index is the chosen one) and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.
static Node newEquivalence(Node operator)
          Creates a new equivalence node representing the query defined by the given operator node and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.

Method Detail

newEquivalence

public static final Node newEquivalence(Iterator<? extends Node> operators,
                                        int choice)
Creates a new equivalence node gathering the equivalent queries represented by the given operator nodes (the node having the specified index is the chosen one) and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.

Parameters:
operators - an iteration over the operator nodes representing the equivalent queries gathered by the returned equivalence node.
choice - the choice of the returned equivalence node, i.e., the index of the equivalence node's child that is actually chosen to represent the query.
Returns:
a new equivalence node gathering the equivalent queries represented by the given operator nodes (the node having the specified index is the chosen one) and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.

newEquivalence

public static final Node newEquivalence(int choice,
                                        Node... operators)
Creates a new equivalence node gathering the equivalent queries represented by the given operator nodes (the node having the specified index is the chosen one) and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.

Parameters:
choice - the choice of the returned equivalence node, i.e., the index of the equivalence node's child that is actually chosen to represent the query.
operators - the operator nodes representing the equivalent queries gathered by the returned equivalence node.
Returns:
a new equivalence node gathering the equivalent queries represented by the given operator nodes (the node having the specified index is the chosen one) and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.

newEquivalence

public static final Node newEquivalence(Node operator)
Creates a new equivalence node representing the query defined by the given operator node and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.

Parameters:
operator - the operator node defining the query that should be represented by the returned equivalence node.
Returns:
a new equivalence node representing the query defined by the given operator node and providing the required local metadata fragments and registers factory methods for this metadata fragments.

getChoice

public static final int getChoice(Node equivalence)
Returns the choice of the given equivalence node, i.e., the index of the child node that represents the equivalence node's query at this time.

Parameters:
equivalence - the equivalence node whose choice should be returned.
Returns:
the choice of the given equivalence node, i.e., the index of the child node that represents the equivalence node's query at this time.
